title: Marqués de Gelida 2010 Brut Exclusive Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Aromas of waffles and corn flakes suggest maturity and complexity. This feels open and wide, with depth to the palate. Direct flavors of lime and tangerine finish more citric and minerally than the nose, with a lasting sense of freshness.

title: Sonoma Collection 2013 District 3 Growers Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Heady with aromas of rose petals, this wine has a thin, light-bodied texture and tastes of black licorice and black cherry. With a surprising ripeness of fruit, it ends without tension or nuance.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2014 Aveta Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Stony and tropical in personality, this full-bodied white wine conjures up the taste and aroma of vanilla crème brûlée with a twist of lemon. The body is tense in acidity and the finish lean and mid-length.

title: Renieri 2011 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Espresso, menthol, dried black-skinned fruit and toasted oak aromas come together on this firm red. The hearty palate offers dried black cherry, licorice, powdered sage and coffee alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2017.

title: Ouled Thaleb 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Zenata)
description: Aromas of white peach and honeysuckle yield to flavors of grapefruit, peach, jasmine and orange blossom. This wine is smooth in the mouth and the zesty finish is characterized by lingering floral flavors.

title: Skyfall 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Raspberry, herb and sugared-plum aromas are followed by easy-drinking red-fruit flavors that show a sense of balance that keeps the interest high.

title: Nagy 2012 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Clarissa Nagy, whose main job is making wine for Riverbench, sources grapes from the nearby Garey Ranch Vineyard for this bottling. It shows strawberry, plum blossom, beet juice, rose petals and cola on the nose. The palate is light and easy, with flavors of pencil lead, Earl Grey tea and brisk cranberry juice.

title: Poggio Verrano 2007 Chance  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Aromas of stewed prune, grilled pepper and roasted coffee bean join in this blend of 45% Merlot, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Sangiovese and 10% Cabernet Franc. The evolved palate shows date, vanilla and coconut. Drink sooner rather than later.

title: Terre Nere Campigli Vallone 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Forest floor, grilled porcini, charred earth and a whiff of leather lead the nose. The ripe palate offers dried black cherry, raspberry, clove, licorice and tobacco alongside chewy tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close.

title: The Lost Colony 2013 Red (Sonoma County)
description: Floral and funky, this combines 47% Syrah, 42% Malbec, 10% Cabernet Franc and 1% Viognier. Medium-strength, it's a rustic, dusty wine with notes of blackberry, blueberry and a touch of dried herb.

title: Tierce 2013 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Intense smoke and dusty mineraity has become a calling card of sorts for Tierce, the annual collaborative bottling of three Finger Lakes Riesling producers. Deeply savory on the palate as well, pronounced notes of chalk and slate are broken by staccato strikes of sour green apple and lime. It's a distinct and increasingly consistent style now for Tierce that has served it well over the years.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2014 Pelio Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: From vines that sit at 1,000 feet overlooking Monterey and the Carmel Valley, this wine only went through partial malolactic fermentation. It shows a tight nose of lemon-laced sour cream and grapefruit blossoms. Lime peels, more sour cream and stronger grapefruit-pith flavors mark the tight, tart palate that has firmness that will mellow with age.

title: Summerland 2014 Vintners Select Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Delicate aromas of sliced Meyer lemons and tangerine show on the nose of this wine that is named after a seaside hamlet just south of Santa Barbara. There is textural weight to the palate, which offers flavors of green apple, jasmine, pear and sour cream, with intriguing dashes of chive.

title: Noble Tree 2013 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is big, burly and complex, showing a preponderance of dark, ripe black fruit built around dusty tannins, leather and lavender. It's compelling and drinking well now.

title: :Nota Bene 2012 Arianses Vineyard Red (Wahluke Slope)
description: This wine is half Cabernet Sauvignon, with the balance Merlot (20%), Cabernet Franc (18%) and a healthy dollop of Petit Verdot. Aromas of green herbs, fresh flowers, soil and barrel spice lead to dark cherry flavors backed by grainy tannins.

title: Le Bertille 2010  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: A little air unlocks aromas of underbrush, scorched earth, blue flower, toasted oak and mature berry. On the firm palate, notes of espresso and licorice add some depth to the core of dried black cherry while grippy, close-grained tannins provide support.

title: Livernano 2012 Casalvento  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned fruit, sunbaked earth, violet and a whiff of espresso lead the nose. The juicy palate doles out ripe black cherry, anise, clove and a hint of coffee alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Kunde 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Tropical and fleshy with upfront acidity, this wine has a full-bodied richness on the nose and overtone, despite a more light-bodied midpalate and finish. Along the way, lemony brightness mingles with a taste of yellow apple.

title: La Cignozza 2011  Chianti
description: Aromas of red berry, sunbaked earth and crushed blue flower lead the nose. The easy-drinking palate offers mature wild cherry, white pepper and anise alongside polished tannins. It's simple but savory. Drink through 2016.

title: La Rasina 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Aromas of toast, coconut, thyme, vanilla and sugared plum cake lead the nose. The round, accessible palate offers black-cherry-marinated in spirits, licorice and a confectionary note framed in mature tannins. Ripe and evolving quickly, this is best suited for near- to mid-term enjoyment.

title: Lambardi 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Earthy aromas of game, porcini mushroom, scorched earth, saline and crushed herb meld together on this. The taut palate offers raw red berry, mineral and grilled sage alongside austere tannins. Drink 2018–2023.

title: Camigliano 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Subdued aromas suggesting stewed plum, mature berry, dried herb and scorched earth lead the nose. The straightforward, rather evolved palate offers dried cherry, cranberry, leather, clove and a green note of powdered sage alongside tightly wound tannins that clench the finish.

title: Castello della Paneretta 2008 Torre a Destra  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, toast, plum cake and menthol lead the nose. The medium-bodied palate offers dried blackberry, black cherry, vanilla and roasted coffee bean accompanied by dusty tannins that leave a drying finish. Drink through 2018.

title: Domaine Chavet 2014 Rosé (Menetou-Salon)
description: This ripe, fruity wine has shiny red-berry fruits and attractive, open acidity. A tang of tangerine zest gives extra zing, although it is the ripe fruit that sings. Drink now.

title: Domaine de la Commanderie 2014 Tradition  (Quincy)
description: Typical of the wines from Quincy, this is herbal and crisp, packed with green fruits that burst out of the glass. Along with its lemon-zest texture, it has a strong mineral element that contrasts with all this fruitiness. Drink now and until 2019.

title: Valmiñor 2014 Minius Godello (Monterrei)
description: Stony, minerally aromas of green apple and lemon are clean and focused. The palate follows that lead, showing minerally crispness along with firm but not cutting acidity. Apple, pear and peach flavors finish glassy and fresh.

title: Château du Petit Thouars NV Brut du Petit Thouars Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This wine was made from grapes grown on the Petit Thouars estate by sparkling-wine producer Langlois-Château. It is ripe, deliciously fresh with touches of yellow fruits as well as brighter citrus. Fruity acidity comes in at the end. Drink now.

title: Château du Trignon 2013 Roussanne (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Plump and round in the mouth, with clean, fresh flavors of pear and pineapple. This year, the Marsanne is better, although the Roussanne should win friends for its charming fruit.

title: Budimir 2008 Triada Prokupac (Župa)
description: This is a 100% Prokupac from Serbia that leads with red cherry, black plum and some mild eucalyptus scents. In the mouth, there are flavors of black fruits, spice and a touch of mint. The tannins are well rounded and the finish is spicy.

title: Buty 2014 Sémillon-Sauvignon-Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Sémillon (60%) makes up the majority of this blend followed by Sauvignon Blanc (22%) and Muscadelle. The aromas of wet stone, lees, orange rind and fresh flowers are light and elusive. The palate brings a sense of elegance and balance.
